did.abstract: Diary (44 pp.) chiefly describing Gardner's daily routines and life in Nantucket during the mid-19th century. She describes arrivals of whaling ships, health of people in community, and pastimes. Details enthusiastic welcome Lucy Stone received when she came to Nantucket to lecture about women's rights and abolition.
